definition: to tremble/to shake out/to reveal/to make it in the world
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: Before entering the house he stamped his feet to shake the snow off his boots.
sentences.chinese: 进屋前他跺跺脚来抖落靴子上的雪。

sentences.english: The dog shook off the drops of water.
sentences.chinese: 那狗抖落掉身上的水珠。

sentences.english: Zeus stood up to shake off the dung pellet, and the eggs were thrown to the ground without his thinking.
sentences.chinese: 宙斯站起身来抖落粪蛋，没留神把鹰卵也抖掉了。

sentences.english: And opening the apron that held her flowers she shook them all out at her grandfather's feet.
sentences.chinese: 海蒂打开围裙把花朵都抖落在爷爷脚旁。

sentences.english: He stamped his feet to shake off the snow from his boots.
sentences.chinese: 他顿脚以便抖落皮靴上的雪。

definition: very slight sound/rustling (onom.)/to stream down (of tears)/luxuriant growth (of vegetation)
to float down/to fall gently (snowflakes, leaves etc)
to swirl in the air (of thickly falling snowflakes, flower petals etc)/to flutter about
muddy/covered in (mud, dust, sweat, blood etc)/daubed in
to push lightly/to flick to one side/to get rid of
